residential_units.unit_development_type: Part Conversion / Part Change of Use
Part Conversion / Part Change of Use

description: Conversion of the existing first floor ancillary office space (Use Class E(C)(i)) and the first floor section of Flat 1 (two bedroom, four person flat) to a one bedroom, two person flat, a two bedroom, three person flat, and an office with toilet (Use Class E(g)(i)), with ancillary access, waste storage and cycle parking, and retention of a reduced size second floor one bedroom, two person flat.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (2107-P10 (Rev C); 2107-P15 (Rev A)  Received:  08 December 2021,  2107-P11 (Rev A); 2107-P12 (Rev A); Unreferenced Design & Access Statement Rev B  Received:  23 November 2021, 4245KJ - 2021.09 ER; 2107-P13 (Rev A)  Received:  30 September 2021, 4245KJ - 2021.09 ER  Received:  19 August 2021, 2107-P01; 2107-P02; 2107-P03; 2107-P04; 2107-P05; 2107-P06; 2107-P07; 2107-P14; Unreferenced Fire Safety Statement  Received:  16 August 2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The proposed additional first floor rear window shall match the size, design, colour and materials of the buildings' existing first floor single rear windows.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, a detailed design and/ or manufacturer product specification for a secure, accessible and sheltered lockable cycle parking unit with Sheffield style stands to be positioned as indicated in the approved drawings for Flats 3 and 4 hereby approved, designed in accordance with the WestTRANS Cycle Design Guidance, shall be implemented and permanently retained lifetime of the development.  
Access shall be permanently provided to the occupiers of Flats 3 and 4 hereby approved to the relevant secured cycle storage unit for each flat and to the site's rear most courtyard.

Condition : 5 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, the designated internal waste/ recycling stores within Flats 1, 3 and 4 and the office, as illustrated in the approved drawings, shall be installed.  
The responsible person stated in the approved Design & Access Statement shall ensure the appointment of an appropriate and frequent commercial waste collection for the approved office.  All waste generated by the office shall be held in its internal waste store between collections, be placed bagged only on the public highway for collection no earlier than 12 hours before the scheduled collection date/ time and any remaining uncollected waste or bins shall be removed from the public highway on the same day as the collection is scheduled.  
Residents of the flats hereby approved shall deposit their residual waste and, when available in the longer term, mixed dry recyclables and food waste in the correct designated on street communal collection bins provided by the Council for collection.  
No waste, recyclable materials or bins related to flats and the office shall be stored on the public highway (including next or surrounding the Council's designated on street collection bins), in the site's rear courtyards or the building's internal stairwell and external stairs at any time.

Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering for the proposed flats so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to Section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the flats shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.

Condition : 7 - i.	The development shall be implemented in accordance with the submitted Energy Statement hereby approved and prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates) under the Standard Assessment Procedure shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been constructed in accordance with the Energy Statement hereby approved, and any subsequent approved revisions.  

ii.	Upon final commencement of operation of the zero greenhouse gas emissions technology hereby approved, suitable devices for their monitoring shall have been installed and monitoring data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the flats hereby approved, the new flats shall be installed with equipment and fittings to ensure that the development would achieve an internal water use of 105 litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved materials details meeting the following standards:

i.	At least 50% of timber and timber products used in the redevelopment shall be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) providers.  
ii.	No construction or insulation materials used in the redevelopment shall release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - No demolition or construction works shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm Monday to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturday.  No construction works shall take place on Sunday or Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.  No materials or other construction deliveries or waste collections shall take place at the site outside of these hours.  

The developer shall monitor the condition of the adjoining highway before and after each delivery and/or collection and the highway shall be cleaned immediately if any waste/ debris is shed onto the public highway or pavement, removing all such debris to a collection point within the development site. 

Measures shall be put in place to suppress and minimise dust generation, vibration and noise disturbance from the development.

Condition : 11 - The existing building's side entrance door and internal stairwell (serving Flats 1 and 3), and the site's existing side entrance gates, rear most courtyard and elevated external stairs, shall be permanently maintained in a safe, useable and attractive condition.

Condition : 12 - Prior to the occupation of the flats hereby approved, the rear most courtyard's existing soil planting borders shall be planted to enhance the appearance and biodiversity.  These existing soil planting borders shall be permanently retained and provide well-maintained and attractive planting.
